openAPIV3Schema.description:
SGConfig stores the configuration of the StackGres Operator

> **WARNING**: Creating more than one SGConfig is forbidden in order to avoid misbehaviours. The single SGConfig should be created automatically during installation.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: Spec defines the desired state of SGConfig

adminui.description: Section to configure Web Console container

image.description: Section to configure Web Console image

service.description: Section to configure Web Console service.

exposeHTTP.description: When set to `true` the HTTP port will be exposed in the Web Console Service

loadBalancerIP.description:
LoadBalancer will get created with the IP specified in
this field. This feature depends on whether the underlying cloud-provider supports specifying
the loadBalancerIP when a load balancer is created. This field will be ignored if the
cloud-provider does not support the feature.

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description:
If specified and supported by the platform,
this will restrict traffic through the cloud-provider load-balancer will be restricted to the
specified client IPs. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the
feature.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/access-application-cluster/configure-cloud-provider-firewall/

nodePort.description: The HTTPS port used to expose the Service on Kubernetes nodes

nodePortHTTP.description: The HTTP port used to expose the Service on Kubernetes nodes

type.description:
The type used for the service of the UI:
* Set to LoadBalancer to create a load balancer (if supported by the kubernetes cluster)
  to allow connect from Internet to the UI. Note that enabling this feature will probably incurr in
  some fee that depend on the host of the kubernetes cluster (for example this is true for EKS, GKE
  and AKS).
* Set to NodePort to expose admin UI from kubernetes nodes.

authentication.description: Section to configure Web Console authentication

createAdminSecret.description: When `true` will create the secret used to store the admin user credentials to access the UI.

oidc.description: Section to configure Web Console OIDC authentication

password.description:
The admin password that will be created for the Web Console.

If not specified a random password will be generated.

secretRef.description:
Allow to specify a reference to a Secret with the admin user credentials for the Web Console.

In order to assign properly permissions. Make sure the `user` field match the value of the `k8sUsername` key in the referenced Secret.

type.description:
Specify the authentication mechanism to use. By default is `jwt`, see https://stackgres.io/doc/latest/api/rbac#local-secret-mechanism.
 If set to `oidc` then see https://stackgres.io/doc/latest/api/rbac/#openid-connect-provider-mechanism.

user.description:
The admin username that will be created for the Web Console

Operator bundle installation can not change the default value of this field.

cert.description: Section to configure the Operator, REST API and Web Console certificates and JWT RSA key-pair.

autoapprove.description:
If set to `true` the CertificateSigningRequest used to generate the certificate used by
 Webhooks will be approved by the Operator Installation Job.

certDuration.description:
The duration in days of the generated certificate for the Operator after which it will expire and be regenerated.
If not specified it will be set to 730 (2 years) by default.

certManager.description: Section to configure cert-manager integration to generate Operator certificates

autoConfigure.description:
When set to `true` then Issuer and Certificate for Operator and Web Console / REST API
 Pods will be generated

duration.description: The requested duration (i.e. lifetime) of the Certificates. See https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io%2fv1

encoding.description: The private key cryptography standards (PKCS) encoding for this certificate’s private key to be encoded in. See https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io/v1.CertificatePrivateKey

renewBefore.description: How long before the currently issued certificate’s expiry cert-manager should renew the certificate. See https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io%2fv1

size.description: Size is the key bit size of the corresponding private key for this certificate. See https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io/v1.CertificatePrivateKey

createForOperator.description: When set to `true` the Operator certificate will be created.

createForWebApi.description: When set to `true` the Web Console / REST API certificate will be created.

regenerateCert.description: When set to `true` the Operator certificates will be regenerated if `createForOperator` is set to `true`, and the certificate is expired or invalid.

regenerateWebCert.description: When set to `true` the Web Console / REST API certificates will be regenerated if `createForWebApi` is set to `true`, and the certificate is expired or invalid.

regenerateWebRsa.description: When set to `true` the Web Console / REST API RSA key pair will be regenerated if `createForWebApi` is set to `true`, and the certificate is expired or invalid.

secretName.description:
The Secret name with the Operator Webhooks certificate issued by the Kubernetes cluster CA
 of type kubernetes.io/tls. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#tls-secrets

webCertDuration.description:
The duration in days of the generated certificate for the Web Console / REST API after which it will expire and be regenerated.
If not specified it will be set to 730 (2 years) by default.

webRsaDuration.description:
The duration in days of the generated RSA key pair for the Web Console / REST API after which it will expire and be regenerated.
If not specified it will be set to 730 (2 years) by default.

webSecretName.description:
The Secret name with the Web Console / REST API certificate
 of type kubernetes.io/tls. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#tls-secrets

containerRegistry.description: The container registry host (and port) where the images will be pulled from.

operator.description: When set to `true` the Operator will be deployed.

restapi.description: When set to `true` the Web Console / REST API will be deployed.

developer.description:
Section to configure developer options.

Following options are for developers only, but can also be useful in some cases ;)

allowPullExtensionsFromImageRepository.description:
If set to `true` and `extensions.cache.enabled` is also `true`
 it will try to download extensions from images (experimental)

disableArbitraryUser.description: It set to `true` disable arbitrary user that is set for OpenShift clusters

enableJvmDebug.description:
Only work with JVM version and allow connect
 on port 8000 of operator Pod with jdb or similar

enableJvmDebugSuspend.description:
Only work with JVM version and if `enableJvmDebug` is `true`
 suspend the JVM until a debugger session is started

externalRestApiIp.description: Set the external REST API IP

externalRestApiPort.description: Set the external REST API port

patches.description: Section to define patches for some StackGres Pods

adminui.description: Section to define volumes to be used by the adminui container

clusterController.description: Section to define volumes to be used by the cluster controller container

distributedlogsController.description: Section to define volumes to be used by the distributedlogs controller container

jobs.description: Section to define volumes to be used by the jobs container

operator.description: Section to define volumes to be used by the operator container

restapi.description: Section to define volumes to be used by the restapi container

showDebug.description: If set to `true` add extra debug to any script controlled by the reconciliation cycle of the operator configuration

useJvmImages.description: The operator will use JVM version of the images

version.description: Set the operator version (used for testing)

cache.description:
Section to configure extensions cache (experimental).

This feature is in beta and may cause failures, please use with caution and report any
 error to https://gitlab.com/ongresinc/stackgres/-/issues/new

enabled.description:
When set to `true` enable the extensions cache.

This feature is in beta and may cause failures, please use with caution and report any
 error to https://gitlab.com/ongresinc/stackgres/-/issues/new

hostPath.description:
If set, will use a host path volume with the specified path for the extensions cache
 instead of a PersistentVolume

persistentVolume.description: Section to configure the extensions cache PersistentVolume

size.description:
The PersistentVolume size for the extensions cache

Only use whole numbers (e.g. not 1e6) and K/Ki/M/Mi/G/Gi as units

storageClass.description:
If defined set storage class
If set to "-" (equivalent to storageClass: "" in a PV spec) disables
 dynamic provisioning
If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClass spec is
 set, choosing the default provisioner.  (gp2 on AWS, standard on
 GKE, AWS & OpenStack)

preloadedExtensions.description: An array of extensions pattern used to pre-loaded estensions into the extensions cache

items.description: An extension pattern used to pre-loaded estensions into the extensions cache

repositoryUrls.description:
A list of extensions repository URLs used to retrieve extensions

To set a proxy for extensions repository add parameter proxyUrl to the URL:
    `https://extensions.stackgres.io/postgres/repository?proxyUrl=<proxy scheme>%3A%2F%2F<proxy host>[%3A<proxy port>]` (URL encoded)

Other URL parameters are:

* `skipHostnameVerification`: set it to `true` in order to use a server or a proxy with a self signed certificate
* `retry`: set it to `<max retriex>[:<sleep before next retry>]` in order to retry a request on failure
* `setHttpScheme`: set it to `true` in order to force using HTTP scheme

autoEmbed.description:
When set to `true` embed automatically Grafana into the Web Console by creating the
 StackGres dashboard and the read-only role used to read it from the Web Console

dashboardConfigMap.description:
The ConfigMap name with the dashboard JSON in the key `grafana-dashboard.json`
 that will be created in Grafana. If not set the default

dashboardId.description:
The dashboard id that will be create in Grafana
 (see https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards). By default 9628. (used to embed automatically
 Grafana)

Manual Steps:
 
Create grafana dashboard for postgres exporter and copy/paste share URL:
- Grafana > Create > Import > Grafana.com Dashboard 9628
Copy/paste grafana dashboard URL for postgres exporter:
- Grafana > Dashboard > Manage > Select postgres exporter dashboard > Copy URL

datasourceName.description: The datasource name used to create the StackGres Dashboard into Grafana

password.description:
The password to access Grafana. By default prom-operator (the default in for
 kube-prometheus-stack helm chart). (used to embed automatically Grafana)

schema.description:
The schema to access Grafana. By default http. (used to embed manually and
 automatically grafana)

secretName.description:
The name of secret with credentials to access Grafana. (used to embed
 automatically Grafana, alternative to use `user` and `password`)

secretNamespace.description:
The namespace of secret with credentials to access Grafana. (used to
 embed automatically Grafana, alternative to use `user` and `password`)

secretPasswordKey.description:
The key of secret with password used to access Grafana. (used to
 embed automatically Grafana, alternative to use `user` and `password`)

secretUserKey.description:
The key of secret with username used to access Grafana. (used to embed
 automatically Grafana, alternative to use `user` and `password`)

token.description:
The Grafana API token to access the PostgreSQL dashboard created
 in Grafana (used to embed manually Grafana)

Manual Steps:
 
Create and copy/paste grafana API token:
- Grafana > Configuration > API Keys > Add API key (for viewer) > Copy key value

url.description:
The URL of the PostgreSQL dashboard created in Grafana (used to embed manually
 Grafana)

user.description:
The username to access Grafana. By default admin. (used to embed automatically
 Grafana)

webHost.description:
The service host name to access grafana (used to embed manually and
 automatically Grafana). 
The parameter value should point to the grafana service following the 
 [DNS reference](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/dns-pod-service/) `svc_name.namespace`

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy used for images loaded by the Operator

jobs.description: Section to configure Operator Installation Jobs

image.description: Section to configure Operator Installation Jobs image

pullPolicy.description: Operator Installation Jobs image pull policy

annotations.description: Section to configure Operator Service annotations
Section to configure Operator ServiceAccount annotations

allowAutobind.description:
If set to false disable automatic bind to Prometheus
  created using the [Prometheus Operator](https://github.com/prometheus-operator/prometheus-operator).
If disabled the cluster will not be binded to Prometheus automatically and will require manual
  intervention by the Kubernetes cluster administrator.

rbac.description: Section to configure RBAC for Web Console admin user

create.description:
When set to `true` the admin user is assigned the `cluster-admin` ClusterRole by creating
 ClusterRoleBinding.

restapi.description: Section to configure REST API Pod

image.description: Section to configure REST API image

service.description: Section to configure REST API Service

serviceAccount.description: Section to configure REST API ServiceAccount
Section to configure Operator Installation ServiceAccount

annotations.description: Section to configure Installation ServiceAccount annotations

create.description: If `true` the Operator Installation ServiceAccount will be created

shardingSphere.description: Section to configure integration with ShardingSphere operator

serviceAccount.description: Section to configure ServiceAccount used by ShardingSphere operator

name.description: The name of the ServiceAccount used by ShardingSphere operator

namespace.description: The namespace of the ServiceAccount used by ShardingSphere operator

status.description: Status defines the observed state of SGConfig

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

token.description: Grafana Token that allow to access dashboards

items.description: Grafana URL to StackGres dashboards preceded by the dashboard name and a semicolon `:`

removeOldOperatorBundleResources.description: Indicate when the old operator bundle resources has been removed

version.description: Latest version of the operator used to check for updates

conditions.message: the initial names have been accepted
